title: Curecanti National Recreation Area: Park Home
body: Deep Water and Big Fish  Curecanti National Recreation Area is a series of three reservoirs along the once wild Gunnison River. The reservoirs that make up Curecanti today are a destination for water-based recreation high in the Rocky Mountains. Best known for salmon and trout fishing, Curecanti also offers opportunities for hiking, boating, camping, and bird watching.              The Boat Tour   Join a park ranger for a leisurely 1.5 hour boat tour through the upper Black Canyon.            Camping   Our 10 campgrounds have a variety of services to accommodate tents or recreational vehicles.        Take a Hike   Curecanti offers the hiker diversity of habitat, scenic vistas, wildlife, and wildflowers.              Webcams   Check out what's happening right now at Curecanti.        Pets   Information about where pets are allowed in Curecanti.        Annual Boat Permit By Mail   For your convenience, annual boat permits are available by mail.
